awd_abstract_narration: This work addresses questions of nonclassical behavior of                  light in laser and micromasers.                                                      Four projects will be examined.  Two concern the dynamics                  of two level atoms interacting with the electromagnetic field,                  the third deals with nonclassical states and higher order                       squeezing and the fourth, the theory of twisted phase                           operators.  The long time behavior of the Jaynes-Cummings                       model is examined in order to define probability distributions                  for atomic quantities and independent and coupled micromasers                   studied to explore differences from normal laser systems.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: RESEARCH FOUNDATION OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK
